intro: Lampranthus martleyi, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often with a distinctive red or purple throat. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Lampranthus martleyi is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to bloom profusely during the winter months.
